title: Problem Overview
content:
**Erdős Problem #271: Stanley Sequences**

For n, define A(n) greedily avoiding 3-APs.

**Questions:**
1. Explicit formulas?
2. Growth rates?

**Status:** PARTIALLY OPEN
mathContext: Connects to additive combinatorics and base representations.

title: Three-term AP
content:
**IsThreeAP(a, b, c):**

a < b < c with 2b = a + c.

The middle term is the average of the outer terms.

title: AP-Free Set
content:
**IsAPFree(S):**

No three elements of S form a 3-term AP.

Stanley sequences are maximal AP-free sets built greedily.

title: AP-Free (Alternative)
content:
**IsAPFree'(S):**

For a < b < c in S: 2b ≠ a + c.

More explicit formulation.

title: Next Stanley Element
content:
**nextStanleyElement(S, start):**

Find smallest m ≥ start keeping S ∪ {m} AP-free.

The core of the greedy construction.

title: Stanley Sequence
content:
**stanleySequence(n):**

a₀ = 0, a₁ = n, then greedy AP-avoidance.

The central object of study.

title: Strictly Increasing
content:
**stanley_strictly_increasing:**

∀k: stanleySequence(n, k) < stanleySequence(n, k+1)

Stanley sequences are always strictly increasing.

title: Sequence is AP-Free
content:
**stanley_ap_free:**

All initial segments of Stanley sequences are AP-free.

The defining property preserved by construction.

title: Has Digit 2 in Base 3
content:
**hasDigit2InBase3(n):**

∃k: (n / 3^k) mod 3 = 2

Checks if base-3 expansion contains digit 2.

title: No Digit 2 in Base 3
content:
**noDigit2InBase3(n):**

Base-3 expansion uses only digits 0 and 1.

These are exactly the elements of A(1)!

title: A(1) Characterization
content:
**a1_characterization:**

n ∈ A(1) ⟺ noDigit2InBase3(n)

The fundamental explicit formula for A(1).

title: A(1) Elements
content:
**a1_elements:**

First elements: 0, 1, 3, 4, 9, 10, 12, 13, 27, ...

These are sums of distinct powers of 3.

title: A(1) Growth Rate
content:
**a1_growth_rate:**

aₖ ~ k^(log₂3) ≈ k^1.585

The 'nice' growth rate achieved by A(1).

title: A(3^k) Characterization
content:
**odlyzko_stanley_power_of_3:**

Similar base-3 characterization exists for A(3^k).

Generalizes the A(1) result.

title: A(2·3^k) Characterization
content:
**odlyzko_stanley_twice_power_of_3:**

Similar characterization for A(2·3^k).

Another family with explicit formulas.

title: Log Base 2 of 3
content:
**log2of3:**

log₂(3) = ln(3)/ln(2) ≈ 1.585

The growth exponent for 'nice' Stanley sequences.

title: Polynomial Growth
content:
**hasPolynomialGrowth(n):**

aₖ ~ k^(log₂3) asymptotically.

First conjectured growth type.

title: Quadratic-Log Growth
content:
**hasQuadraticLogGrowth(n):**

aₖ ~ k²/log k asymptotically.

Second conjectured growth type.

title: Dichotomy Conjecture
content:
**odlyzko_stanley_dichotomy_conjecture:**

Every A(n) has either polynomial or quadratic-log growth.

The main OPEN conjecture!

title: A(4) Conjecture
content:
**lindhurst_a4_conjecture:**

A(4) has quadratic-log growth (OEIS A005487).

Computational evidence from Lindhurst (1990).

title: Moy's Upper Bound
content:
**moy_upper_bound:**

∀ε>0: aₖ ≤ (1/2 + ε)k² for large k.

Proven upper bound from 2011.

title: Explicit Upper Bound
content:
**van_doorn_sothanaphan_explicit:**

aₖ ≤ (k-1)(k+2)/2 + n for all k ≥ 0.

Fully explicit, no 'eventually' qualifier.

title: Quadratic Upper Bound
content:
**quadratic_upper_bound:**

aₖ ≤ k²/2 + k + n = O(k²).

Simplified form of the explicit bound.

title: A(1) Values
content:
**a1_known:**

[0, 1, 3, 4, 9, 10, 12, 13, 27, 28, 30, 31]

OEIS A003278. Sums of distinct powers of 3.

title: A(4) Values
content:
**a4_known:**

[0, 4, 5, 6, 8, 9, 10, 11, 13]

OEIS A005487. Conjectured quadratic-log growth.

title: Sum-Free Sets
content:
**IsSumFree(S):**

No a + b = c with a, b, c ∈ S.

Related but different from AP-free.

title: AP-Free ≠ Sum-Free
content:
**ap_free_neq_sum_free:**

{1, 2, 4} is AP-free but not sum-free.

The conditions are distinct.

title: Main Result
content:
**erdos_271:**

1. A(1) has explicit base-3 characterization
2. Upper bound aₖ ≤ (k-1)(k+2)/2 + n holds

Combines known results.

title: Historical Timeline
content:
**historical_timeline:**

- 1978: Odlyzko-Stanley characterizations and conjecture
- 1990: Lindhurst computational evidence
- 2011: Moy's upper bound

title: Open Problem
content:
**dichotomy_is_open:**

The Odlyzko-Stanley dichotomy conjecture remains OPEN.

Proving or disproving it is the main challenge.
